TextBody:
Hi Danielle,

We hope you are doing well.

Please find below the communication regarding this issue:

Netwrix has received reports that following the deployment of CoSoSys Endpoint Protector Hotfix #1 the system may cease to process certain events. Netwrix has confirmed this behavior and is working on a revision to Hotfix #1 to resolve this issue. As a precaution, Netwrix has temporarily paused distribution of the hotfix until a replacement is available.
 
Customers who have deployed Hotfix #1 and are experiencing an issue with processing events should contact the Netwrix support team.

Our devs are already looking into this issues and I have informed them that you are affected by it too. I will get back to you as soon as I receive an update on this.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Caoia:ref
Subject: ADV-2024-002 - Hotfix issue    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Caoia:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Danielle,

Could you please provide us with the below information?

1. What is the EPP server version you are running?
2. Where is the EPP server hosted(on-prem/AWS/GCP/AZURE/EPP hosted)?
3. Was the EPP server upgraded with the Vulnerability patch through Live update or Offline Patch
4. Which EPP clients version do you currently used?

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Danielle,

We hope you are doing well.

Please find below the communication regarding this issue:

Netwrix has received reports that following the deployment of CoSoSys Endpoint Protector Hotfix #1 the system may cease to process certain events. Netwrix has confirmed this behavior and is working on a revision to Hotfix #1 to resolve this issue. As a precaution, Netwrix has temporarily paused distribution of the hotfix until a replacement is available.

Customers who have deployed Hotfix #1 and are experiencing an issue with processing events should contact the Netwrix support team.

Our devs are already looking into this issues and I have informed them that you are affected by it too. I will get back to you as soon as I receive an update on this.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 7/3/2024 12:21 AM
To: drochford@nixonpeabody.com
Subject: ADV-2024-002 - Hotfix issue [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Caoia:ref ]

Hi Danielle,

We hope you are doing well.

Please find below the communication regarding this issue:

Netwrix has received reports that following the deployment of CoSoSys Endpoint Protector Hotfix #1 the system may cease to process certain events. Netwrix has confirmed this behavior and is working on a revision to Hotfix #1 to resolve this issue. As a precaution, Netwrix has temporarily paused distribution of the hotfix until a replacement is available.
 
Customers who have deployed Hotfix #1 and are experiencing an issue with processing events should contact the Netwrix support team.

Our devs are already looking into this issues and I have informed them that you are affected by it too. I will get back to you as soon as I receive an update on this.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
